channel.title: Field Expedient SDR
channel.description: Recent content on Field Expedient SDR

item.title: Field Expedient Linux
item.description: David has also written a book explaining the Linux command line, called Field Expedient Linux. You can find out more at http://www.fieldlinux.com

item.title: SDR Links
item.description: More From Us Factoria Labs - http://www.factorialabs.com Field Expedient Linux - http://www.fieldlinux.com gnuradio Installation Downloads and Info PyBombs GitHub - https://github.com/gnuradio/pybombs SDR Hardware Links HackRF One - https://greatscottgadgets.com/hackrf/ Helpful Sites for Questions and Answers SDR tagged items on dsp.stackexchange - http://dsp.stackexchange.com/tags/sdr/hot SDR tagged items on electronics.stackexchange - http://electronics.stackexchange.com/tags/sdr/hot SDR tagged items on ham.stackexchange - http://ham.stackexchange.com/tags/sdr/hot

item.title: Buy The Books
item.description: All volumes of the Field Expedient SDR series are available on [Amazon Australia] (http://www.amazon.com.au) in the Kindle format. We apologize for our inability to serve this market with a paperback format but hope you will enjoy the full-color ebook. Volume 1 Volume 2 Volume 3 [Kindle (full color)] (http://www.amazon.com.au/dp/B01M15DO0S) [Kindle (full color)] (http://www.amazon.com.au/dp/B01LXKJRSA) [Kindle (full color)] (http://www.amazon.com.au/dp/B01M15ECBR) The links above are for purchase in Australia.

item.title: Buy The Books
item.description: All volumes of the Field Expedient SDR series are available on [Amazon Canada] (http://www.amazon.ca) in paperback and Kindle formats. The paperbacks are available with a black and white interior as well as a full-color interior. Because the gnuradio interface color-codes some of its elements, there is additional value in the color versions. Unfortunately, the printing costs of full-color books are much more expensive, so we’ve also provided the more affordable black-and-white versions.

item.title: Contact the Authors
item.description: Both authors provide consulting services as well as training classes for SDR. For more information, please see the [Factoria Labs] (http://www.factorialabs.com) web site, or contact us at the following address: email: sdr<at>factorialabs.com

item.title: Installing gnuradio
item.description: UPDATE: The installation instructions in the books are now completely out of date and do not support the most recent version of Ubuntu. Rather than provide a new set of instructions, we’ve simplified things by creating an installation script that handles almost everything. Please see the following post for details: [Updated gnuradio Install Instructions] (https://factorialabs.com/2020/01/11/updated-gnuradio-install-instructions-2/)

item.title: Downloads
item.description: Each book in the Field Expedient SDR Series walks through a host of exercises. Below you can download a single *.tar.gz file for each book. Each file contains all of the completed exercises and raw data files referenced in its associated book. You should download the file to a convenient location and then run the following command: tar -xvzf <filename> The files are broken down into folders for each chapter, and the top level contains a text file called “project_list.

item.title: About the Field Expedient SDR Series
item.description: First some comments from fans of the series: There is a whole world out there waiting for you. A world not seen by many people. This book opens the world of SDR to the masses and makes it approachable, fun and useful. It is required reading for all Black Hills Information Security team members. John Strand Owner - Black Hills InfoSec Senior Instructor for SANS If you are looking for a practical, top down approach for GNURadio and SDR proficiency, this series is precisely what you’re looking for.

item.title: Field Expedient SDR
item.description: Welcome to the Field Expedient SDR web site. Here you can learn about the books and check out the latest gnuradio installation guide.

This website was generated using the [Hugo] (https://gohugo.io/) static web page toolset. Further, it used the [hyde-y] (https://github.com/enten/hyde-y) theme, which is licensed per the terms below.
